articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kang Nung Su
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Kang Nung Su
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Tuesday sent a wreath to the bier of Presidium Member of the Central Committee of the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea Kang Nung Su, deputy to the Supreme People's Assembly and recipient of Order of Kim Il Sung, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets New Lao, Malaysian Ambassadors
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets New Lao, Malaysian Ambassadors
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong separately met and had talks with new Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Phonekham Inthaboualy and new Malaysian Ambassador to the DPRK Mohammad Nizan Bin Mohammad who paid courtesy calls on him on Tuesday.

articles.title: FM Spokesman Slams U.S. for Deliberately Linking Negotiations with Iran over Nuclear Issue with DPRK
articles.content:
FM Spokesman Slams U.S. for Deliberately Linking Negotiations with Iran over Nuclear Issue with DPRK 
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK Tuesday gave the following answer to the question put by KCNA as regards the fact that the U.S. is deliberately linking the conclusion of the agreement on the nuclear issue of Iran with the DPRK:
					 The U.S. is talking this and that over the nuclear issue of the DPRK in the wake of the conclusion of the agreement on the nuclear issue of Iran. 
					
					 A spokesperson of the U.S. Department of State said on July 14 that "Washington is ready for dialogue with Pyongyang if discussion is made on the nuclear issue of north Korea and it helps put it on a concrete and full-fledge stage of nuclear disarmament." 
					
					 A U.S. under secretary of State uttered on July 16 that it was his hope that the conclusion of the agreement with Iran would help the DPRK rethink of its nuclear issue. 
					
					 Iran's nuclear agreement is the achievement made by its protracted efforts to have its independent right to nuclear activities recognized and sanctions lifted.
					
					 But the situation of the DPRK is quite different from it.
					
					 The DPRK is the nuclear weapons state both in name and reality and it has interests as a nuclear weapons state.
					
					 The DPRK is not interested at all in the dialogue to discuss the issue of making it freeze or dismantle its nukes unilaterally first.
					
					 The nuclear deterrence of the DPRK is not a plaything to be put on the negotiating table as it is the essential means to protect its sovereignty and vital rights from the U.S. nuclear threat and hostile policy which have lasted for more than half a century.
					
					 It is illogical to compare Iran's nuclear agreement with the situation of the DPRK which is exposed to constant provocative military hostile acts and the biggest nuclear threat of the U.S. including its ceaseless large-scale joint military exercises.
					
					 The DPRK remains unchanged in the mission of its nuclear force as long as the U.S. continues pursuing its hostile policy toward the former.

articles.title: Report on Results of Local Elections in DPRK Released
articles.content:
Report on Results of Local Elections in DPRK Released
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The Central Election Guidance Committee of the DPRK on Monday released a report on the results of the elections of deputies to local people's assemblies.
					 According to the report, the elections of deputies to the provincial (municipal), city (district) and county people's assemblies of the DPRK were successfully held on Sunday as required by the Law on the Elections of Deputies to the People's Assemblies at All Levels.
					
					 According to the election returns available from the provincial (municipal), city (district) and county election committees, 99.97 percent of all the voters registered in the lists took part in the elections and voted for the candidates for deputies registered in the relevant constituencies.
					
					 Only those on foreign tour or working in oceans could not take part in the elections.
					
					 28 452 workers, farmers, intellectuals and officials were elected deputies to the local people's assemblies.

articles.title: Military Attaches Corps Visits Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
articles.content:
Military Attaches Corps Visits Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The military attaches corps here visited the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum on the occasion of the 62nd anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War Tuesday.
					 Military attaches paid tribute to the statue of President Kim Il Sung waving back to the columns of the military parade at the square for celebrating the victory in the war.
					
					 They laid bouquets before the sculpture "Victory" in the Monument to the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War and paid respects to the service personnel of the heroic Korean People's Army.
					
					 They went round several rooms of the museum, being briefed on the fact that the KPA and the people of the DPRK beat back the armed invasion by the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces and won a brilliant victory under the leadership of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Mothers of Girl Fighter Pilots Meet Women's Union Members
articles.content:
Mothers of Girl Fighter Pilots Meet Women's Union Members 
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Mothers of Jo Kum Hyang and Rim Sol, the first group of girl supersonic fighter pilots, met officials and members of the women's union at the Hall of Women on Tuesday. 
					 Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the women's union, congratulated the mothers of Jo Kum Hyang and Rim Sol, who grew to be proud daughters of the country and its people and indomitable women revolutionaries. Members of the women's union presented the mothers with bouquets. 
					
					 Their mothers said that Marshal Kim Jong Un saw to it that their daughters became excellent supersonic fighter pilots, taking their wishes to become pilots into deep consideration. 
					
					 Saying that they are touched by the loving care shown by Kim Jong Un for projecting ordinary girls as filial daughters of heroic Korea and flowers in the sky of Songun Korea, they recalled with excitement that he bestowed upon them the honor of extending his warm salute to them. 
					
					 The care of Kim Jong Un, indeed, represents the care of the great father who trains not only the girl fighter pilots but all other sons and daughters of the country as heroes with indomitable spirit, the mothers added. 
					
					 Speeches were made to renew their pledges.

articles.title: Anniversary of Publication of DPRK-Russia Joint Declaration Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Publication of DPRK-Russia Joint Declaration Marked
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- A film show was held at the Chollima Hall of Culture on Tuesday to mark the 15th anniversary of the publication of the DPRK-Russia Joint Declaration.
					 Present there were Kim Jin Bom, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries who doubles as chairman of the DPRK-Russia Friendship Association, officials concerned, Pyongyangites, charge d'affaires ad interim Alexandr Minaev and staff members of the Russian embassy here and Russian guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					 The participants watched the Korean documentary "The Great Leader Comrade Kim Jong Il Meets Putin, President of the Russian Federation."

articles.title: Law on Protection of National Heritage Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
Law on Protection of National Heritage Issued in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK newly adopted and promulgated the Law on the Protection of National Heritage, the replacement of the Law on the Protection of Cultural Heritage. 
					 The new law breaks into six chapters and 62 articles, which deal with various issues arising in unearthing, gathering, estimating, registering and preserving national heritages.
					
					 The adoption of the law provides a firm legal guarantee for properly protecting and carrying forward national heritages on the principles of the Juche character, historicism and scientific accuracy as required by the developing situation.

articles.title: Rain Spell to Begin in DPRK
articles.content:
Rain Spell to Begin in DPRK 
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Rain spell will begin in overall parts of Korea from this weekend, according to the weather forecast made by the State Hydro-meteorological Administration.
					 Sultry weather continues in the country, due to the high pressure developing itself over northwest Pacific from July 19.
					
					 It drizzled for long time in the southern area of the west coastal area on July 20, a clear manifestation of transition to rainy season.
					
					 It will frequently shower in most parts of the country till July 23. And the rainy season is anticipated to begin from July 24 or 25.
					
					 In particular, there will be heavy rainfall in some parts of the west coastal area on July 25 and 26.

articles.title: Japan's Double-Dealing Attitude toward Liquidation of Past Crimes Revealed
articles.content:
Japan's Double-Dealing Attitude toward Liquidation of Past Crimes Revealed
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Japan's war criminal enterprise Mitsubishi made an official apology to the U.S. for forcing U.S. POWs to work at coal mines, factories, etc. in Japan during World War II, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 Victims and their bereaved families and members of civic and public organizations of south Korea have staged actions against the Japanese government and enterprises in demand of their apology and reparation for unethical atrocities.
					
					 But the Japanese government and enterprises are shamelessly asserting that the "claims including forcible labor conscription had already been settled by the south Korea-Japan agreement" in a bid to create the impression that the issue of the Korean victims of forcible labor conscription was completely and finally settled.
					
					 Japan is still denying the legal responsibility for its past crimes and refusing to make any official apology and reparation for them, keen on reviving militarism to carry out its ambition for reinvasion.

articles.title: Minju Joson Demands Retraction of Security Legislation in Japan
articles.content:
Minju Joson Demands Retraction of Security Legislation in Japan 
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- 90 percent of the Japanese constitutional scholars who responded to the recent opinion poll over the security bills said the amendments to the security bills were a breach of the constitution. 
					 Earlier, all the three constitutional scholars who were invited as witnesses to a constitutional examination at the House of Representatives of Japan expressed their views that the security legislation was a breach of the constitution. 
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard: 
					
					 It was not accidental coincidence that the constitutional scholars of Japan expressed the above-said common views on the security bills.
					
					 The security bills are a breach of the "Pacifist constitution" because their purpose goes against the spirit of the constitution. 
					
					 It is quite natural that most of Japanese people are concerned that the security legislation will spark off preemptive attack by other countries and put the security of Japan at peril. 
					
					 Japan would be well advised not to forget the lesson taught by history. 
					
					 If the present Japanese authorities persistently go to war of aggression, oblivious of the above-said lesson of history in which great many Japanese people lost their lives, Japan will never be able to get out of the abyss of ruin. 
					
					 The Japanese politicians should always remember that war of aggression would not bring prosperity to Japan but put its existence at peril.

articles.title: Dictatorial Rule Bound to Collapse: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Dictatorial Rule Bound to Collapse: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The south Korean chief executive betrayed her despicable true colors as a dictator by exercising veto over a "draft amendment to the law of the National Assembly" which passed through it in June. Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says this in an article.
					 This fact fully exposed once again the true picture of the political landscape in south Korea where democracy has been wantonly violated and dictatorial rule holds sway, the article says, and goes on: 
					
					 The ruling method of the present chief executive puts into the shade that of the military fascist junta which earned ill-fame for dictatorship.
					
					 It is the inevitability of history for the dictatorial regime to go to ruin as it chills the aspiration and wishes of the popular masses for independence and blocks progress and democratic development of society. 
					
					 It is evidenced by the history of the south Korean people's struggle for democratization against fascism. 
					
					 Their struggle for democratization against fascism is not over. 
					
					 Running high is the resentment of south Korean people from all walks of life at the puppet ruling forces who have turned the society into tundra of democracy and human rights through unprecedented fascist dictatorship rule after mercilessly trampling down the precious fruition of their bloody struggle for democratization. 
					
					 It is the unanimous will of the south Korean people of different social standings to put an end to the dictatorial and quisling regime. 
					
					 Much upset by the massive struggle of the people against the regime, it is resorting to the brutal suppression. But it will spark off bitterer anger of the popular masses. 
					
					 The harsher suppression and dictatorship get, the stronger people's resistance will grow. 
					
					 The harsher dictatorial rule of the puppet group would only precipitate its self-destruction. 
					
					 The dictatorial rule will collapse anytime.

articles.title: Tricksters Bound to Invite International Disgrace: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Tricksters Bound to Invite International Disgrace: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- A Japanese magazine recently carried an article refuting a misinformation floated by the south Korean puppet forces that a chemical weapons expert of the DPRK sought refuge in Europe.
					 According to it, Yonhap News of south Korea quoted an anonymous source on June 6 as saying that a chemical weapons expert of the DPRK sought refuge in Finland via Philippines, bringing with him data on chemical weapons test on living body and he is allegedly expected to make them public at a meeting of the European Parliament late in July.
					
					 But the confirmed information proved to be a sheer fabrication, 
					
					 Media of Finland said its government totally denied the story about the exile of a Korean chemical weapons expert.
					
					 The European Parliament refuted the report released by Yonhap News as groundless
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary says this case is by no means the story faked up by the south Korean puppet forces alone but a co-product of them and the U.S., old hand at intrigues and fabrications.
					
					 The U.S. and south Korean puppet forces sought a sinister aim in spreading the above-said story. 
					
					 Driven into a tight corner at home and abroad, they required a plausible charade to conceal their cynic ploy for a germ warfare and divert elsewhere public opinion at home and abroad. 
					
					 They may use poor gimmick to mislead the public opinion at home and abroad, but this can never work in this bright world.
					
					 No matter what false propaganda the puppet forces may stage against the DPRK in league with their master, this will only invite international criticism, ridicule and disgraceful doom.

articles.title: Killing of Civilians during Korean War Disclosed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Killing of Civilians during Korean War Disclosed in S. Korea 
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- The Women's Society for Achieving Peace in south Korea on July 17 held a meeting in Sanchong, South Kyongsang Province to disclose killing of civilians by the south Korean puppet army during the past Korean war, according to the south Korean internet paper Thongil News. 
					 Victims testified that in February 1951, the 3rd Battalion of the 9th Regiment of the 11th Division of the puppet army massacred more than 700 civilians in a day in Kumso-myon, Sanchong County and several villages in Hamyang County of South Kyongsang Province under the pretext of "operation for routing communist bandits". This was part of the "operation plan" of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces, they said. 
					
					 Referring to the fact they narrowly escaped death in the site of massacre and had lived in pain and nightmare, the victims expressed their towering resentment at the merciless killers of their kinsfolk. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the authorities have not taken any measure for probing the truth behind the massacre, the victims said.

articles.title: Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia Introduced by Russian, Senegalese Media
articles.content:
Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia Introduced by Russian, Senegalese Media
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Russian and Senegalese media introduced Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia.
					 The Russian paper Selskaya Zhizn on July 9 dedicated a whole page to an article titled "Flowers praising leaders" illustrated with a photo showing the revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung. The article explained how Kimilsungia and Kimjongilia came into being in the world and that they received top prizes at the world horticultural expos and exhibitions.
					
					 The Senegalese paper Le Populaire on July 6 said in an article titled "Great man and famous flower" Kimilsungia was named at the proposal of Sukarno, the first president of the Republic of Indonesia.
					
					 The Senegalese radio on July 8 aired the following program:
					
					 Kimilsungias are being cultivated and disseminated in various parts of the world and they win admiration of so many people.
					
					 The 1st Kimilsungia Festival was held in Pyongyang in April 1999.
					
					 The flower received top prizes at the world horticultural expos and exhibitions including the one held in Shenyang, China in 2006.
					
					 The President is still alive in the hearts of humankind together with Kimilsungia.

articles.title: Foreign Media Praise Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Foreign Media Praise Kim Il Sung
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried special write-ups or aired special programs from July 6 to 13 on the 21st anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Lao news agency released the following article titled "Model internationalist" illustrated with a portrait of the smiling President:
					
					 The President defended Russia with arms even in the harsh days when he was waging an arduous armed struggle against the Japanese imperialists with neither assistance from a regular army nor state-backed home front to liberate Korea from the Japanese military occupation.
					
					 He also rendered sincere support to the Chinese revolution.
					
					 He rendered material and moral support to the countries and nations in their struggles for independence against imperialism, notably the Cuban and Vietnamese peoples in their anti-U.S. struggle, while building socialism in the ceaseless confrontation with the U.S. imperialists after the Korean war.
					
					 The history of struggle in Laos, Syria, Angola, Namibia and many other countries is recorded with his noble internationalist obligation.
					
					 The Bangladeshi paper Daily Folk said in an article titled "Eternal sun of Juche" the President is still alive in the hearts of all people as the sun of Juche as he ushered in the era of independence and dedicated his whole life to the cause of human independence.
					
					 The Congolese paper Le Patriot carried a portrait of the smiling President with articles titled "Motto of President Kim Il Sung" and "Iron-willed brilliant commander".
					
					 The Egyptian TV broadcasting service praised the President for performing great exploits for the Korean revolution and the cause of global independence.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day to Be Celebrated in Russia
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day to Be Celebrated in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- A Karelia, Russia, preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation was formed on July 16. 
					 Victor Yegorov, chairman of the Karelia-DPRK Friendship Association of Russia, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to significantly organize political and cultural events including a lecture and seminar to praise the revolutionary career and exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il from July 16 to August 17.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Celebrated in Uganda
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Celebrated in Uganda
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- A Ugandan preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of Korea's liberation and the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea was formed in Kampala on July 16.
					 Kirunda Kivejinja, senior adviser to the president of Uganda, was elected adviser to the preparatory committee and Henri Masico, department director of the Presidency of Uganda, its chairman.
					
					 The committee decided to hold colorful political and cultural events including a meeting, seminar and photo show.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Lauded by Ugandan Personage
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Lauded by Ugandan Personage
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung was an iron-willed commander who defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialismts in one generation and the great statesman as he developed the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) into the popular party deeply rooted among the people.
					 Kirunda Kivejinja, senior advisor to the president of Uganda, said this in a speech at an inaugural ceremony of the Ugandan preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of Korea's liberation and the founding of the WPK on July 16.
					
					 He praised Kim Il Sung as a peerless patriot and national hero who led the anti-Japanese war to victory, liberating Korea from the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule.
					
					 The Korean people are achieving great successes in the drive for building a thriving nation and reunifying the country under the guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un, he stressed.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Celebrated in Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Celebrated in Kyrgyzstan
						
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- A Kyrgyz preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of Korea's liberation and the founding of the Worker's Party of Korea was formed in Bishkek on July 16.
					 A. Usupbayev, chairman of the Central Council of the People Unity-"Kyrgyz El" Republican Political Party who doubles as chief of the Group for the Study of the Juche Idea of Kyrgyzstan, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold political and cultural events to praise the exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Foreign Personages
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Foreign Personages 
 Pyongyang, July 21 (KCNA) -- Diverse events took place in foreign countries on the 21st anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included a remembrance meeting and film show in Pakistan, a remembrance meeting in Denmark, a lecture in Nigeria and a film show in Angola on July 6 and 7.
					
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos documenting the revolutionary exploits of the President and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Participants of Korean films watched films dealing with exploits performed by the President for national reunification.
					
					 Zabed Ansari, secretary general of the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association, the general secretary of the Sind State Committee of the Pakistan Awami National Party and other speakers praised the President as the founder of the Juche idea and Songun idea, founding-father of socialist Korea and the most experienced world elder statesman with noble personality. 
					
					 Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, noted the President's exploits would shine forever with the cause of independence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Kang Nung Su
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de difunto Kang Nung Su
						
Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un envio el dia 21 una ofrenda floral ante el feretro del difunto Kang Nung Su, condecorado con la Orden Kim Il Sung, diputado a la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y presidente del Comite Central del Frente Democratico para la Reunificacion de la Patria, en senal de profundas condolencias por su fallecimiento.

articles.title: Vocero de MINREX condena a EE.UU. por unir asunto nuclear de RPDC con el de Iran
articles.content:
Vocero de MINREX condena a EE.UU. por unir asunto nuclear de RPDC con el de Iran
Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ACNC) -- A la pregunta de un reportero de la Agencia Central de Noticias de Corea (ASNC) formulada en relacion con que Estados Unidos relaciona el resultado de las negociaciones nucleares de Iran con la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC respondio el dia 21 como sigue:
					Aprovechando el reciente acuerdo relativo al problema  nuclear de Iran, EE.UU. habla de tal o cual sobre el problema nuclear de la RPDC.
					
					El pasado dia 14, el vocero del Departamento de Estado norteamericano dijo que "si se discute el problema del plan nuclear del Norte de Corea y se entra en la etapa concreta y activa de la reduccion nuclear" EE.UU. esta dispuesto a participar en el dialogo de ese tipo. Tambien, el asistente del secretario de Estado norteamericano expuso el dia 16 que desea que la promocion del acuerdo nuclear de Iran nos hiciera corregir nuestro criterio.
					
					El acuerdo nuclear de Iran es el exito de este pais persico logrado por sus esfuerzos de largo tiempo para recibir el reconocimiento sobre su derecho a las actividades nucleares independientes y desmantelar la sancion.  
					
					Pero, la realidad de la RPDC es completamente distinta del caso de Iran.
					
					La RPDC es el pais poseedor de armas nucleares, que tiene el interes como pais nuclear.
					
					No tiene interes nunca en el dialogo para discutir sobre la  congelacion o renuncia unilaterales de armas nucleares.
					
					El disuasivo nuclear de la RPDC constituye el medio indispensable para defender la soberania del pais y el derecho a vivir desde la amenaza nuclear y la politica hostil de EE.UU. que continua mas de medio siglo, razon por la cual no puede ser el asunto para poner en la mesa de negociaciones.
					
					Es absurdo que EE.UU. intente comparar el acuerdo nuclear de Iran con la realidad de la RPDC, victima permanente de los actos hostiles militares provocativos y la maxima amenaza nuclear de EE.UU. incluyendo los continuos ejercicios militares conjuntos de gran envergadura.
					
					Mientras exista la politica hostil de EE.UU., no se cambiara jamas la mision de las fuerzas armadas nucleares de la RPDC.

articles.title: CCDE publica informacion sobre resultado de elecciones de diputados
articles.content:
CCDE publica informacion sobre resultado de elecciones de diputados
						
Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ACNC) -- El Comite Central de Direccion Electoral para las elecciones de diputados a las Asambleas Populares de las provincias (las ciudades directamente subordinadas al centro), las ciudades (los municipios) y los distritos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea hizo publica el dia 20 una informacion sobre el resultado de las elecciones.
					Segun el documento, el 19 de julio del 104 (2015) de la Era Juche se realizaron con exito, segun la ley de las elecciones de diputados a las asambleas populares a todos niveles, las elecciones de diputados a las Asambleas Populares de las provincias (las ciudades directamente subordinadas al centro), las ciudades (los municipios) y los distritos.
					
					Segun el resultado sintetizado a traves de los comites electorales de las provincias (las ciudades directamente subordinadas al centro), las ciudades (los municipios) y los distritos, 99.97% de los votantes registrados en la lista, participaron en los sufragios y votaron 100 % a favor de los candidatos a diputados a las asambleas populares de las provincias (las ciudades directamente subordinadas al centro), las ciudades (los municipios) y los distritos.
					
					Los electores, que estan ahora en otros paises o en alta mar, no participaron en las presentes elecciones.
					
					En los sufragios, 28 mil 452 obreros, campesinos, intelectuales y funcionarios fueron elegidos como diputados de las asambleas populares de las provincias (las ciudades directamente subordinadas al centro), las ciudades (los municipios) y los distritos.

articles.title: Encuentro entre madres de aviadoras de cazas supersonicas y miembros de UMDC
articles.content:
Encuentro entre madres de aviadoras de cazas supersonicas y miembros de UMDC
						
Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 21 en la Casa de la Mujer el encuentro entre las madres de Jo Kum Hyang y Rim Sol, primeras aviadoras de cazas supersonicas y las funcionarias e integrantes de la Union de Mujeres Democraticas de Corea (UMDC).
					En la ocasion la presidenta del Comite Central de la UMDC, Kim Jong Sun, felicito a las madres de Jo Kum Hyang y Rim Sol, crecidas como hijas excelentes de la patria y el pueblo y como revolucionarias indoblegables y varias miembros de la UMDC les obsequiaron ramos de flores.
					
					Las madres de las aviadoras subrayaron que al percatarse de deseos de sus hijas de ser aviadoras, el Mariscal Kim Jong Un hizo de ellas excelentes primeras aviadoras de cazas supersonicas.
					
					Dijeron que el Mariscal formo a ellas como aviadoras de Corea heroica y del Songun y las presento ante todo el mundo, e incluso envio hasta el cordial saludo a las mismas.
					
					Subrayaron que de veras, el Mariscal es el gran padre quien hace no solo de las aviadoras de cazas supersonicas sino tambien de todos los hijos del pais los fuertes en la indoblegable potencia espiritual y los heroes.
					
					A continuacion, pronunciaron discursos de juramento.

articles.title: Proyeccion filmica al 15o aniversario de Declaracion Conjunta Corea-Rusia
articles.content:
Proyeccion filmica al 15o aniversario de Declaracion Conjunta Corea-Rusia
						
Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 21 en la Casa Cultural Chollima la proyeccion filmica dedicada al 15o aniversario de la publicacion de la Declaracion Conjunta Corea-Rusia.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes el presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-Rusia y vicepresidente del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, Kim Jin Bom, los funcionarios interesados junto con los trabajadores capitalinos.
					
					Tambien, participaron Alexandr Minaev, encargado de negocios a.i y otros miembros de la embajada rusa en Corea y  huespedes rusos quienes permanecen en la RPDC.
					
					Los participantes presenciaron el documental coreano "Encuentro del companero Kim Jong Il, gran Dirigente, con el Presidente de la Federacion Rusa Putin".

articles.title: Aprobada en RPDC nueva ley de proteccion de patrimonios nacionales
articles.content:
Aprobada en RPDC nueva ley de proteccion de patrimonios nacionales
						
Pyongyang, 21 de julio (ACNC) -- Recientemente, el Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea aprobo y publico una nueva ley de proteccion de patrimonios nacionales tras invalidar la anterior ley de proteccion de patrimonios culturales.
					La nueva ley esta compuesta por 6 capitulos y 62 articulos, en los cuales aclara detalladamente todos los problemas que se presentan en el descubrimiento, la coleccion, la calificacion, el registro, la administracion y el uso de los patrimonios nacionales.
					
					La nueva ley permite preparar la firme garantia legal para proteger, heredar y desarrollar mejor los patrimonios nacionales en el principio del espiritu Juche y el historicista y cientifico segun la demanda de la epoca en desarrollo incesante.
